image.altText: A man holds a tennis raquet on a court.

props.synopsis: Max Purcell is looking to repeat his win at last year's Cincinnati Open as he takes on Casper Ruud at Margaret Court Arena, with the Aussie doubles duo of Jason Kubler and Rinky Hijikata set to star later on. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie Max Purcell aims to continue winning streak over world No. 11

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Purcell faces Norwegian Casper Ruud in second round
Mouth-watering match-ups today include some big names

image.altText: Kyrgios

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios offers to "climb into the crowd" to sort out a heckler, as Novak Djokovic bemoans a difficult atmosphere at the Australian Open.

title.children: 'There's an absence of courage': Djokovic hits out at Aus Open crowd as Kyrgios offers to 'sort out' heckler

image.altText: Cyclist Melissa Hoskins smiles during an interview.

props.synopsis: Mourners have paid tribute to Perth Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins who died after she was struck by a car allegedly driven by her husband on December 30.

title.children: Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins farewelled by family and friends

image.altText: Princess of wales

props.synopsis: As King Charles seeks treatment for an enlarged prostate, his daughter-in-law faces up to two weeks in hospital after undergoing abdominal surgery.

title.children: King Charles to undergo treatment for enlarged prostate, as Kate Middleton recovers in hospital after surgery

image.altText: Lightning strikes off the coast of a beach

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting warmer-than-average temperatures for much of the country in February, with wetter-than-normal conditions currently underway in central and eastern Australia expected to continue for the rest of January.

title.children: What's in store for Australia's weather for the rest of summer?

image.altText: A line of trucks at a stop

props.synopsis: Truck drivers are warning caravanners not to park in their rest stops because of the potentially devastating consequences of missing a fatigue break.

title.children: Truck drivers plead with caravanners to stay away from truck rest stops

image.altText: a man in a business suit walks outside a court building

props.synopsis: The 28-year-old is accused of causing a horrific road crash in South Australia's Mid North in October that claimed the lives of three people, including one who died in hospital a week after the collision.

title.children: Italian tourist faces court over campervan crash that claimed lives of elderly couple and daughter

image.altText: Dr Ash Gordon wears a white collared shirt and blue blazer and smiles in front of a cream brick wall.

props.synopsis: Two 16-year-old boys have been arrested and charged over the aggravated burglary and murder of Box Hill doctor Ash Gordon.

title.children: Two teenagers charged with murder following death of Melbourne doctor Ash Gordon after home invasion

image.altText: A woman holding a bag on her shoulder looking at the camera, in front of a queue of people

props.synopsis: More parents than ever are turning to charities for assistance to help afford school basics, from the right uniforms and shoes, to extensive textbook and stationery lists.

title.children: At a discount school supplies store in regional Australia, families are lining up down the street

image.altText: A graphic with the front page of the Freedom of Information Act 1982 and other pages behind it

props.synopsis: The NT's Information Commissioner says sluggish responses to FOI requests are "very concerning", after the chief minister's office took almost a year and a half to process some applications.

title.children: The ABC applied for documents under FOI. The department didn't respond for 17 months

image.altText: A stern looking Donald Trump waves as he walks onto city street

props.synopsis: Judge Lewis Kaplan tells Donald Trump his right to be present at the trial may be revoked after the former US president ignores a warning to keep quiet while writer E Jean Carroll testifies how he shattered her reputation when she accused him of sexual abuse.

title.children: Judge in New York civil trial threatens to expel Donald Trump from courtroom

image.altText: Justin Greaves is hugged as Mitch marsh walks off

props.synopsis: Australia will hope to overhaul the West Indies first innings total and establish a big lead on day two of the first Test at Adelaide Oval. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Australia lose three wickets before lunch as West Indies fight back on day two in Adelaide

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: THAT'S LUNCH! Australia 5-144 trails by 44 runs
OUT! Marsh is caught by the in-close third slip! Amazing!
OUT! Khawaja caught in the slips! Greaves strikes!

image.altText: three high-rise buildings visible with trees and grass in foreground

props.synopsis: NSW Building commissioner David Chandler says while there was a "set of circumstances that need to be fixed" at the Macquarie Park development, "there is absolutely no threat to collapse".

title.children: 'Not at risk of failure': Commissioner seeks to reassure community over building collapse fears

image.altText: Spray bottle of Roundup on hardware store shelf

props.synopsis: It's the weedkiller that transformed agriculture, paving the way for farming that is gentler on the land, but now an Australian court is set to determine if glyphosate can cause cancer.

title.children: Farmers say they can't produce food efficiently without Roundup, as class action considers health impacts

image.altText: Business people walk past a shiny black sign that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Economists say Australia's unemployment rate remaining steady at 3.9 per cent in December will be "good news" for the RBA, while the ASX is lower after investors pared back their global rate cut expectations. Follow live.

title.children: Unemployment rate and part-time work shift 'good news' for the RBA ahead of February meeting, ASX falls

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Biggest single month fall in employment since February 1993, outside of COVID
Jobs data 'good news for the Reserve Bank'
Slump in participation rate follows 'larger than usual' recent growth

image.altText: Several people in black hoods walk beside a large truck with boxes stacked up on the truck.

props.synopsis: Medicines for hostages in Gaza and humanitarian aid for civilians have entered the war-torn Palestinian territory under a deal mediated by Doha and Paris, Qatar says.

title.children: Israel and Hamas deal sees humanitarian aid and medicines enter Gaza to help civilians and hostages

image.altText: Indigenous man with hat and glasses waves Aboriginal and Australian flags

props.synopsis: As the annual debate rages on, Ballardong traditional owners in WA's Wheatbelt will use January 26 to launch a three-day festival celebrating community and culture in collaboration with the local council.

title.children: Why this country town is backing January 26 for a joint Australia Day, Indigenous celebration

image.altText: Richard Roxburgh stands in front of scaffolding and a lit-up neon U Star logo of a U and a star shape in a circle.

props.synopsis: New Australian drama series Prosper stars Richard Roxburgh and Rebecca Gibney as the Quinns: the powerful family behind a fictional megachurch.

title.children: Richard Roxburgh and Rebecca Gibney are a megachurch power-couple in Prosper

image.altText: Sabrina Spires and Donald Day Jr

props.synopsis: A US man, allegedly linked to the Wieambilla shooting in Queensland, is facing fresh charges over illegal gun possession and violent threats against FBI agents.

title.children: 'I'm not playing': Court documents reveal alleged terrorist Donald Day's threats against FBI agents

image.altText: Farm workers picking fruit in a field.

props.synopsis: Major PALM scheme employer Plantgrowpick is trading again after entering voluntary administration last year. The company has vowed to make good on its debts to workers, but concerns about its ongoing viability have been raised.

title.children: Workers to be repaid $4m, taxpayers to lose $12m after labour-hire firm saved from collapse

image.altText: A medium shot of a man and a woman, both in suits and glasses, smiling slightly and shaking hands

props.synopsis: After holding talks with Israeli powerbrokers, the foreign minister calls for peace in meetings with Palestinian officials.

title.children: Penny Wong pushes for Gaza ceasefire and two-state solution in first official trip to West Bank

image.altText: A medium shot of four men sitting or standing in the back of a ute in the desert. Some carry guns, one carries rocket launcher.

props.synopsis: A Houthi spokesperson says the militant group considers its new terrorist designation by the United States to be "a badge of honor".

title.children: US announces fresh sanctions on Houthi rebels, relists group as terrorists amid Red Sea attacks

image.altText: What does "net-zero" look like for Australia?

props.synopsis: Company directors could face legal action if they fail to produce credible emissions forecasts, under draft laws proposed by the federal government.

title.children: Companies could be held liable for 'greenwashing' emissions figures under a new proposal

image.altText: A computer generated image of the SLIM spacecraft separating from a rocket

props.synopsis: Japan is planning to land a car-sized spacecraft on the Moon this week. If SLIM succeeds, it will make history and pave the way for building landers that can explore the Solar System's  planets and moons.

title.children: Japan's SLIM spacecraft set to attempt historic '20 minutes of terror' Moon landing this week

image.altText: Photo of black headphones on a yellow background

props.synopsis: It's never too early to start working on getting a great Spotify Wrapped result for the end of 2024. Here are some tips on how you can improve your end-of-year music wrap-up.

title.children: How to get the best Spotify Wrapped for 2024

image.altText: Flowers and teddy bear left near site of a car crash

props.synopsis: Australia has committed to an ambitious target of zero road deaths by 2050, but if the current trend continues, that's near impossible. So what's going wrong?

title.children: Australia thought it could cut road deaths to zero by 2050. What's gone so wrong?

props.synopsis: Ben Shelton was a big fan of the Australian Open crowd and another American shows great sportsmanship after an error. Here are five quick hits from day four at Melbourne Park.

title.children: Five quick hits — Australian fans praised for 'special' atmosphere and ultimate show of sportsmanship after error

image.altText: A close up of a man in a jumper dribbling a basketball on a court

props.synopsis: The Golden State Warriors say they are "absolutely devastated" by their assistant coach's sudden passing.

title.children: NBA coach Dejan Milojević dies aged 46, following heart attack

image.altText: A stock image of a book club, with three people, two women and a young man, looking at a book and laughing

props.synopsis: Reading is a solitary pursuit, but the joy of talking about what you devoured or detested in book club is special.

title.children: Why we keep showing up to book clubs — even when we haven't read the book

image.altText: A line of ambulances queued up down the ramp to the emergency department at the Royal Hobart Hospital.

props.synopsis: Over the past five years, 136 people died in Tasmanian hospitals in the 24 hours after being "ramped", a parliamentary inquiry has been told. But the Health Department warns against drawing conclusions.

title.children: A 75-year-old was ramped at hospital with sepsis. He survived, but 136 others have died after waiting

image.altText: Mason the crocodile lays with his mouth open

props.synopsis: A spike in sightings of large crocodiles on beaches and in Central Queensland waterways can be linked to a "fear factor" driving them out of their usual territory, experts believe.

title.children: Why big crocodiles are on the move in Queensland

image.altText: Two hands hold a little penguin amongst shrubs.

props.synopsis: Researchers say they have found dangerous chemicals in little penguin habitat and populations around Tasmania.

title.children: 'I found PFAS in all except one': Toxic chemicals found in little penguin colonies around Tasmania

image.altText: People look into a volcano over a railing.

props.synopsis: As one of the most volcanically active regions on earth, Indonesia's mountains attract thousands of visitors each year. But the deaths of 24 hikers last month has prompted experts to renew warnings about the dangers of extreme tourism.

title.children: Foul-smelling sulphur and the risk of death won't stop tourists from climbing Indonesia's active volcanoes
